channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: 3 more counts are dismissed in the Trump case indictment in Georgia
item.description: A judge has dismissed three more counts in the Georgia election interference case against former President Donald Trump and his allies.
item.content:encoded:
A judge has dismissed three more counts in the Georgia election interference case against former President Donald Trump and his allies.

(Image credit: Brynn Anderson)
item.dc:creator: Sam Gringlas

item.title: Danity Kane's Dawn Richard sues Sean 'Diddy' Combs for sexual assault and battery
item.description: In the lawsuit filed Tuesday in a New York federal court, Richard alleges that the hip-hop mogul sexually assaulted her, deprived her of food and sleep and refused to pay her adequately.
item.content:encoded:
In the lawsuit filed Tuesday in a New York federal court, Richard alleges that the hip-hop mogul sexually assaulted her, deprived her of food and sleep and refused to pay her adequately.

(Image credit: Paul A. Hebert)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: Navient reaches $120 million settlement for misleading student loan borrowers
item.description: According to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, $100 million will be used to make payments to impacted borrowers in a settlement with the former servicer of student loans.
item.content:encoded:
According to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, $100 million will be used to make payments to impacted borrowers in a settlement with the former servicer of student loans.

(Image credit: Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Franklin

item.title: Making German Chocolate Without Using Cocoa
item.description: Cocoa beans, which are used to make chocolate, are mostly grown in a few places making them susceptible to the effects of extreme weather events, driven by climate change. We hear about a team in Germany that is developing a chocolate made without cocoa.
item.content:encoded: Cocoa beans, which are used to make chocolate, are mostly grown in a few places making them susceptible to the effects of extreme weather events, driven by climate change. We hear about a team in Germany that is developing a chocolate made without cocoa.
item.dc:creator: Rob Schmitz

item.title: In Jordan's elections, anger at Israel over the Gaza war fuels Islamist gains
item.description: The Islamic Action Front, the political wing of the Muslim Brotherhood, is now the single biggest opposition bloc in Jordan's 138-member parliament, winning one-fifth of the seats this week.
item.content:encoded:
The Islamic Action Front, the political wing of the Muslim Brotherhood, is now the single biggest opposition bloc in Jordan's 138-member parliament, winning one-fifth of the seats this week.

(Image credit: Khalil Mazraawi)
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: After more than a century, the Campbell's company drops 'soup' from its name
item.description: The Campbell Soup Company's CEO said the "subtle yet important change" to the name adopted in 1922 better reflects the broad number of products it makes.
item.content:encoded:
The Campbell Soup Company's CEO said the "subtle yet important change" to the name adopted in 1922 better reflects the broad number of products it makes.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: Avie Schneider

item.title: Trump’s Bedminster club hosted an alleged Nazi sympathizer who stormed the Capitol
item.description: At two events, Donald Trump’s New Jersey golf club hosted a convicted Jan. 6 rioter known for extreme antisemitic and racist comments, whom prosecutors described as a ‘white supremacist.’
item.content:encoded:
At two events, Donald Trump’s New Jersey golf club hosted a convicted Jan. 6 rioter known for extreme antisemitic and racist comments, whom prosecutors described as a ‘white supremacist.’

(Image credit: Department of Justice)
item.dc:creator: Tom Dreisbach

item.title: Swift sweeps, Chiles gets her bronze and other highlights from a star-studded VMAs
item.description: The 40th MTV Video Music Awards celebrated today’s biggest stars and songs, as well as iconic moments from its own history. Here are some of the night's best moments and biggest winners.
item.content:encoded:
The 40th MTV Video Music Awards celebrated today’s biggest stars and songs, as well as iconic moments from its own history. Here are some of the night's best moments and biggest winners.

(Image credit: John Shearer)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Keurig misled the public over claims its K-Cup pods are 100% recyclable, the SEC says
item.description: Keurig agreed to pay $1.5 million in penalties — without admitting guilt or denying the SEC's findings that the K-Cup pod producer made inaccurate claims regarding the recyclability of those pods.
item.content:encoded:
Keurig agreed to pay $1.5 million in penalties — without admitting guilt or denying the SEC's findings that the K-Cup pod producer made inaccurate claims regarding the recyclability of those pods.

(Image credit: Michael M. Santiago)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: Four private astronauts conduct the first commercial spacewalk
item.description: NPR's Geoff Brumfiel fills us in on the first private spacewalk, which took place this morning.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Geoff Brumfiel fills us in on the first private spacewalk, which took place this morning.
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel
